current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend title 10, United States Code, to modify the
		  authorities and responsibilities of convening authorities in taking actions on
		  the findings and sentences of courts-martial.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

header.#text:
Modification of authorities
			 and responsibilities of convening authorities in taking actions on the findings
			 and sentences of courts-martial

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(article 60(c) of the Uniform Code of Military Justice),
			 is amended by adding at the end the following new sentence:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Paragraph (2) of section 860(c) of title
			 10, United States Code

quote.#text:
In taking
			 such an action (other than an action to approve a sentence), the convening
			 authority or other person taking such action shall prepare a written
			 justification of such action, which written justification shall be made a part
			 of the record of the court-martial.

header.#text:
Inclusion of
			 written justification for certain actions on sentences

text.#text: Such section (such article) is further amended—

header.#text:
Prohibition on
			 dismissal of finding or change to finding of guilty of lesser included
			 offense

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 by striking the second sentence; and

text.#text:
by adding at the
			 end the following new paragraph:

If a convening authority or other
				person acts on the findings of a court-martial, the convening authority or
				other person may not—

dismiss any charge or specification by
				setting aside a finding of guilty thereto; or

change a finding of guilty to a charge
				or specification to a finding of guilty to an offense that is a lesser included
				offense of the offense stated in the charge or
				specification.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(article 60 of the Uniform Code of Military
			 Justice), as so amended, on or after that date.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 860
			 of title 10, United States Code

text.#text:
The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the
			 date of the enactment of this Act, and shall apply with respect to findings and
			 sentences of courts-martial reported to convening authorities under

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S538 IS: To amend title 10, United States Code, to modify the authorities and responsibilities of convening authorities in taking actions on the findings and sentences of courts-martial.
